Package PaintTool

Class SquarePadDrawing

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • PaintTool.SquarePadDrawing
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    public class SquarePadDrawing
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
    SquarePadDrawing A Class that extends the JPanel and contains all the drawing logic with code
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void blankImage()
      Set the blank image
      static void checkLine​(java.lang.String line)  
      void drawFromFile​(java.util.Scanner scanner)
      Method used to process all lines of input .vec file and draw on the screen image
      void drawGraphics​(java.awt.Graphics2D graphics2D, Tool currentTool, int pointX1, int pointY1, int pointX2, int pointY2, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> xPolyList, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> yPolyList)
      Method used to draw shapes in the graphics context The Tool parameter determines which shape will be drawn For a line, a line is drawn from the brushPoints (x1, y1) to brushPoints (x2, y2) For other shapes, brushPoints (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) give two corners of the shape

      Method used to read draw each line of the input .vec file

      Method used to record the number of mouse clicks to draw the polygon Click the left mouse to add a point to the polygon Right click to stop adding a point to the polygon and draw the polygon
      void mouseDragged​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Method called whenever the user moves the mouse while a mouse button is down If the user is isDrawing a curve, draw a segment of the curve on the off-screen image, and repaint the part and repaint the part of the panel that contains the new line segment.
      void mouseEntered​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)  
      void mouseExited​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)  
      void mouseMoved​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)  
      void mousePressed​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent evt)
      Method called when the user presses the mouse button on the panel begins the draw operation in which the user sketches a curve or draws a shape for PENCIL or BRUSH, a new segment of the curve is drawn each time the user moves the mouse for the other shapes, a "rubber band cursor" is used - the figure is drawn between the starting point and the current mouse location
      void mouseReleased​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Method called when the user releases the mouse button if the user was isDrawing a shape, the shape is drawn to the off-screen image
      void paintComponent​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Method used to set up the painting properties of the screen image
      void popImagesFromStack​(int i)
      Pop i last images from the stack
      void renderRequestImage​(int i)
      Set image from Undo stack with given parameter
      void setCoordinatesAndDraw​(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, java.awt.Color penColorInput, java.awt.Color fillColorInput)
      Use to set coordinates and update drawing when read from .vec file, used in Menu.java when file is imported
      void setCurrentFillColor​(java.awt.Color clr)
      Method used to set the current fill color and add drawing commands into the output file

      • drawGraphics

        public void drawGraphics​(java.awt.Graphics2D graphics2D,
                         Tool currentTool,
                         int pointX1,
                         int pointY1,
                         int pointX2,
                         int pointY2,
                         java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> xPolyList,
                         java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> yPolyList)
        Method used to draw shapes in the graphics context The Tool parameter determines which shape will be drawn For a line, a line is drawn from the brushPoints (x1, y1) to brushPoints (x2, y2) For other shapes, brushPoints (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) give two corners of the shape
        Parameters:
        graphics2D - Graphics class
        currentTool - isSelected tool
        pointX1 - point x1
        pointY1 - point y1
        pointX2 - point x2
        pointY2 - point y2
        xPolyList - list of x coordinates of polygon
        yPolyList - list of y coordinates of polygons

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent evt)
        Method called when the user presses the mouse button on the panel begins the draw operation in which the user sketches a curve or draws a shape for PENCIL or BRUSH, a new segment of the curve is drawn each time the user moves the mouse for the other shapes, a "rubber band cursor" is used - the figure is drawn between the starting point and the current mouse location
        Specified by:
        mousePressed in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Parameters:
        evt - MouseEvent

        Parameters:
        e - MouseEvent

      • mouseDragged

        public void mouseDragged​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Method called whenever the user moves the mouse while a mouse button is down If the user is isDrawing a curve, draw a segment of the curve on the off-screen image, and repaint the part and repaint the part of the panel that contains the new line segment. Otherwise, just call repaint and let paintComponent() draw the shape on top of the picture in the off-screen image.
        Specified by:
        mouseDragged in interface java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
        Parameters:
        e - MouseEvent
